HISTORIC NEWS: the anti-lynching bill I introduced with @CoryBooker & @SenatorTimScott just passed the Senate unanimously. Congress has tried and failed nearly 200 times to make lynching a federal crime.

Live: Kamala Harris and Cory Booker to ask unanimous consent to pass federal anti-lynching legislation https://www.pscp.tv/w/buqGyjFWR2p2cUFEeURPS098MWRqeFhPa292blZKWrlZuNBib7csnK-Tp7TZZz9XQ7xQ6jQO20oAW14-7Opp …

The Texas District Court ruling on the Affordable Care Act doesn’t affect ACA open enrollment. Californians can still sign up by December 21 for coverage beginning January 1, 2019. Or sign up by January 15 for coverage beginning February 1. http://www.CoveredCA.com

Despite these concerns, overall, this measure takes positive steps to improve our justice system, and I intend to vote for it.

It should also further expand application of earned good time credits, place more prohibitions on private prisons which profit from the incarceration of individuals, and further limit the use of electronic monitoring.
To start: all of the bill’s sentencing reforms should be applied retroactively.

But, to be clear, the FIRST STEP Act is very much just that – a first step. It is a compromise of a compromise, and we ultimately need to make far greater reforms if we are to right the wrongs that exist in our criminal justice system.

It also enables the use of good time credits, provides greater access to education and substance abuse treatment. It eliminates the shackling of pregnant prisoners, requires healthcare products for incarcerated women, and ends federal juvenile solitary confinement.
It allows judges greater discretion to reduce unfair sentences for low-level, nonviolent drug offenders and eliminate unjust sentencing enhancement.

This bill reforms some of the most draconian federal sentencing laws, including unfair mandatory minimum sentences under two- and three-strikes laws, and retroactively applying the reduced sentencing disparity between crack and powder cocaine.
For too long sentencing has been overly severe & disproportionately targeted communities of color – especially Black men.
Americans deserve a criminal justice system that is both fair and smart. By passing the FIRST STEP Act, we can start to make our criminal justice system smarter.
I wanted to share my thoughts with you all in a quick thread on the FIRST STEP Act, a criminal justice reform bill that the Senate will begin voting on tonight.

In many places across the country, today is the last day to sign up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act. (Californians, remember that you have until January 15 to sign up.) Be sure to visit  http://Healthcare.gov  today & #GetCovered.

It's unacceptable that companies' price increases limit access to lifesaving medicine. Yesterday my colleagues & I introduced a bill to prohibit price gouging for all drugs covered by federal health care programs & increase federal oversight of excessive drug price increases.
